summary: SBA's largest lending program—known as 7(a)—encourages private lenders to offer loans to small businesses that might not otherwise get funding, with SBA guaranteeing a portion of the loan. The program usually pays for itself. But in its FY 2020 budget, SBA estimated that the program would cost $99 million. We were asked to review SBA's estimation methods in light of this change. We found that...
title: Small Business Loans: SBA Generally Incorporated Key Elements for Estimating Subsidy Cost of 7(a) Program
